metadata.synopsis: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.

5.speaker: Rath
5.text: I wish I could offer more assistance. For now, I must keep a close watch on Kagha.

7.speaker: Rath
7.text: I hope to see both you and Halsin again soon.

15.speaker: Rath
15.text: You have saved Kagha from herself. I cannot thank you enough.

21.speaker: Rath
21.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: A child is dead. You don't deserve mercy.

2.speaker: Rath
2.text: You may be right. We've let a snake replace our leader. And the result... By the Treefather, that girl...

50.speaker: Player
50.text: That snake must be held accountable.

40.speaker: Rath
40.text: By every star, by every vein on every leaf, she must.

73.speaker: Rath
73.text: This has only happened because our true leader was taken from us.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Kagha seems happy to rule the roost. Who's your real leader?

9.speaker: Rath
9.text: Master Halsin. Perhaps goblin-caught, perhaps dead. He'd set... Mistress Kagha back in line. Hold her to task. Stop this damned ritual.

25.speaker: Rath
25.text: More will die if the rite is finished. So many more, sent into a world gone mad...

19.speaker: Player
19.text: If no one's looking for Halsin, I could do it.

30.speaker: Rath
30.text: Would you? I would give anything to see Halsin return home.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: No need to fret. I'll find him.

92.speaker: Rath
92.text: Silvanus' blessing upon you. And my gratitude as well.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I'd like a more solid offer than 'anything'.

81.speaker: Rath
81.text: Our need is great. I will open the treasures of this grove to you, even if the circle forbids it.

22.speaker: Rath
22.text: Halsin is an elf with the presence of a bear. He left west, with the adventurers.

94.speaker: Rath
94.text: You won't mistake the First Druid for anyone else.

70.speaker: Rath
70.text: Your dismissal is no shield. Kagha will ensure all outsiders are driven from the grove.

42.speaker: Rath
42.text: Should you change your mind, head west. Halsin is an elf with the presence of a bear.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I found Halsin in the goblin camp, but he can't return yet.
96.context: InternalNodeContext: show this only if the player didn't already find Halsin, no need to be redundant if the player already knows

3.speaker: Rath
3.text: Please, do whatever you must to get him home. The grove needs him.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I found Halsin in the goblin camp, but he didn't survive.
4.context: InternalNodeContext: show this only if the player didn't already find Halsin, no need to be redundant if the player already knows

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I'm in need of a healer. Badly.
58.context: InternalNodeContext: show this only if the player didn't already find Halsin, no need to be redundant if the player already knows

59.speaker: Rath
59.text: Like many, you seek Halsin's craft. But you'll have to settle for Nettie.
59.context: InternalNodeContext: show this only if the player didn't already find Halsin, no need to be redundant if the player already knows

66.speaker: Rath
66.text: Find her further in the cave. Her gift is great, too - you can trust her.
66.context: InternalNodeContext: show this only if the player didn't already find Halsin, no need to be redundant if the player already knows

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Sounds like Halsin might be the better bet. Where is he?

41.speaker: Rath
41.text: The adventurers say they lost track of him in a temple to the west.

90.speaker: Rath
90.text: Would that I could track himself myself. But I cannot leave with Kagha doing as she wills.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I'll take my chances on Nettie.

57.speaker: Rath
57.text: I pray she can heal what ails you.

54.speaker: Rath
54.text: Ah, I see. You will find her deeper in the caves.

77.speaker: Rath
77.text: It is what Kagha desires. I doubt it is what Silvanus wants.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: The girl's parents will want vengeance.

61.speaker: Rath
61.text: This is how a terrible cycle begins. All is out of balance.

45.speaker: Rath
45.text: We need Master Halsin. Without him, Kagha's ritual will divide this grove forever.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: That girl's parents want vengeance - and they deserve it.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: How did Kagha take over the whole grove?

13.speaker: Rath
13.text: She is First Druid in Halsin's absence. With him caught - or dead - by goblins, none may gainsay her.

69.speaker: Rath
69.text: But more will die if her ritual is finished. I doubt those exiled by the rite will survive long outside.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: The child is to blame. She shouldn't have stolen in the first place.

78.speaker: Rath
78.text: Preventable. The sickening result of sickening beliefs.

29.speaker: Rath
29.text: We let this happen. We let this snake replace our leader.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: You let Kagha befoul this sacred place with a child's blood, yet you plead 'mercy'? Coward.

28.speaker: Rath
28.text: May he rest in Summeroak forever. I...
28.context: InternalNodeContext: HALSIN IS DEADNodeContext: Grieving, voice trailing off.

11.speaker: Rath
11.text: ...I apologise. I must have some time to myself.

44.speaker: Rath
44.text: I hope to see Halsin return so he can help us heal.
44.context: InternalNodeContext: Kagha Turned good but died in the fight against the shadow druids

86.speaker: Rath
86.text: Please, if you find him, let me know.

56.speaker: Rath
56.text: I pray the Treefather nourishes Kagha's wounded soul, now that she is dead.
56.context: InternalNodeContext: Kagha Turned good but died in the fight against the shadow druids

62.speaker: Rath
62.text: You did well to speak up for the girl. That snake is fickle. A tragedy prevented.
62.context: NodeContext: Grateful for the player's help, irritated at the 'snake' (Kagha)

63.speaker: Rath
63.text: Well seen. Well spotted. We've let a snake replace our leader.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: And if I hadn't spoken up? What would have happened?

0.speaker: Rath
0.text: Nothing befitting a child. Nothing befitting any of our world's creatures.

12.speaker: Rath
12.text: We've let a snake replace our leader. She will see the tieflings driven out, or worse.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I've heard there's some sort of ritual going on.

79.speaker: Rath
79.text: One meant to seal us in. Meant to seal them out. Blasphemous. The Treefather must see what's happening in his holy grove.

36.speaker: Rath
36.text: Perhaps his eyes are on Master Halsin now.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I swore an oath to stop terrible deeds like that. Monsters like her.

74.speaker: Rath
74.text: Until Master Halsin returns, my eyes must stay on Kagha.

87.speaker: Rath
87.text: To think Kagha had turned to the ways of shadow. Her corruption ran so deep.

37.speaker: Rath
37.text: Yet for her to die like this, under the Treefather's gaze... perhaps it is justice.

10.speaker: Rath
10.text: If only justice soothed my heart. A grove drenched in blood is no sanctuary at all.
